title: React Podcast
description: Conversations about React with your favorite developers.

title: JavaScript Air
description: The live broadcast podcast all about JavaScript and the Web

title: HTTP 203
description: Surma and Jake talk about whatever's going on in the world of web development.

title: JavaScript Jabber
description: Weekly podcast discussion about Javascript on the front and back ends. Also discuss programming practices, coding environments, and the communities related to the technology.

title: The Vanilla JS Podcast
description: A show about JavaScript for people who hate the complexity of modern front‑end web development.

title: The Changelog: Software Dev & Open Source
description: Conversations with the hackers, leaders, and innovators of software development.  Hosts Adam Stacoviak and Jerod Santo face their imposter syndrome so you don’t have to. Expect in-depth interviews with the best and brightest in software engineering, open source, and leadership. This is a polyglot podcast. All programming languages, platforms, and communities are welcome. Open source moves fast. Keep up.

title: Svelte Radio
description: Things about Svelte. Sometimes weekly, sometimes not.

title: Maintainers Anonymous
description: How can we work together to achieve a common goal: whether in our code, cities, or infrastructure? Henry Zhu chats with fellow maintainers across all disciplines of life on their process, motivations, and struggles as they learn in public.

title: Exponent
description: A podcast about tech and society, hosted by Ben Thompson and James Allworth

title: Freakonomics Radio
description: Discover the hidden side of everything with Stephen J. Dubner, co-author of the Freakonomics books. Each week, Freakonomics Radio tells you things you always thought you knew (but didn’t) and things you never thought you wanted to know (but do) — from the economics of sleep to how to become great at just about anything. Dubner speaks with Nobel laureates and provocateurs, intellectuals and entrepreneurs, and various other underachievers. Special features include series like “The Secret Life of a C.E.O.” as well as a live game show, “Tell Me Something I Don’t Know.”
